page.title: 06DEPDEN GREEN
page.content: Depden Green is an area of grazing land covering 44 acres (including 4 acres of Budd Green) in the conservation village of Depden pop. 200. Owned by Mr. M.A. Rabett, Lord of the Manor, who lives at Depden Hall, a 450 year old moated house. The moat having been recently re-excavated, pieces of Cormwellian armour being found and a large quantity of old bottles. Seven people own grazing rights on the Green for example: 2 cattle or 12 sheep or 1 1/2 horses or 3 gaggle of geese The rights belong to adjoining or nearby properties. Only Mr. Rabett (84) and Mr. Stavely (16) excerise the right to graze sheep. The Green must be kept in a condition suitable for grazing, therefore, no trees may be planted and no tracks are allowed.
